pros: Great experience teaching undergraduate courses with autonomy over my course management style, but support from more senior faculty members. There are many opportunities for professional development in pedagogy.
cons: It is a large university and can feel like you are lost in the shuffle (also a sentiment shared by undergrads) but if you make yourself available to get involved and take advantage of resources this is not a problem.

pros: I don't know how higher ed careers have reputation for being the path of slackers. Or maybe I'm just fortunate to have a job that's always changing, keeps me on my toes, and is highly demanding and engaging.
cons: We all know that higher ed administrators say that "we have good benefits but not much in the way of salary." Plus there's a lot said about the low cost of living in Athens, which is becoming decreasingly true.

pros: Good environment, Friendly staff, potential for job expansion with the right credentials. Ability to gain experience.
cons: I found it kind of hard to be accepted for a position without having a bachelor degree. I have two associates and currently working on a bachelor's and although I had several potential interviews, I could not land a full time position. I was mostly considered for part time temporary, but those jobs only lasted around four months if that long.

job_title: Lab Manager I in Athens, GA
pros: Athens is a "just the right size" kind of town; many departments and many opportunities; excellent health insurance and retirement benefits.
cons: Pay not on par with private industry; Though a major university, it's still more about who you know than what you know at times.

pros: The central campus IT organization is an excellent place to grow a career. Good leadership, clear priorities and meaningful work. They have a set-aside for training and travel and are good at identifying and developing talent in-house. Athens is also a great place to live and raise a family.
cons: Budget constraints sometimes make things difficult, and salaries lag behind Atlanta as a result. Filling open positions can be challenging if you are a manager.

review_title: It is just picking people up from places on campus
pros: I like it because of the people that I worked with were all friendly and the Sargent is very nice
cons: The hours are long and sometimes there is just so many calls and  you feel like you can't handle it all

pros: Nothing..it is in the middle of nowhere...1 walmart to shop in 50 miles radius.
cons: Too much racial discrimination. Do not even think about working at Tifton GA for the University of Georgia.

job_title: Graduate Teaching Assistant in Athens, GA
pros: Great school campus. Friendly people. Great town to live.
cons: Get a tuition waiver but still have to pay fees that are in excess of $1000 a semester. TA loads could be very different depends on your assigned duties. Only allow to work 1/3 hours (may vary for different departments), which makes terrible pay. When asked the supervisor, the answer is that earning money is not important for students. However, living expenses and institutional fees have increased.

job_title: Student Back End Developer in Athens, GA
pros:
-Able to learn new skills
-Welcoming environment and people
-Lenient with taking time off
cons:
-Admins put money over people even during a pandemic
-Within a university system, so restricted by state authority
-Low pay for staff and some faculty positions compared to other universities

pros: State agency. Good benefits for full-time employees. Stable employment even through the recession. The university is still in a period of growth and expansion. Oh, and good sports teams that do a lot to improve the mood on campus and at work.
cons: No benefits for part time workers and temps. So many of the workers, especially custodial staff and food services are working at minimum wage, which is really hard to get by on.

pros: Flexible scheduling based on your schedule. Ramsey is a great work environment. Easy to pick up shifts and get more hours. Great way to have a job, while still being a student. They understand you are a student first.
cons: Since it is part time there is a limit to how many hours you can work and there isn't room for much advancement, but besides that it was a great place to work.

review_title: The good is good, the bad is bad
pros: Very flexible scheduling, helpful for student workers that can get off shifts to study for exams.
cons: UGA is very cheap to their employees. Minimum wage, hard work, and they don't even pay for employee parking. Even the janitors have to pay for parking access to the buildings

pros: I enjoyed working here. The benefits are great and Athens is a wonderful city. The culture is great for anyone who likes academia.
cons: I wish the environment was a bit more progressive, but overall I don't have many bad things to say about working at UGA.

review_title: Tutoring for The University of Georgia provided a great opportunity and better than minimum wage pay.
pros:
Very convenient to work on campus.
Pay was more than minimum wage.
You get to work alongside other knowledgable and friendly people.
cons:
The work is monotonous and as a tutor you will see the same problems every semester and multiple times the same day.
Some of the students who come in for tutoring come with the intent of being helped on every question.

review_title: Had a fabulous experience until the grant money ran out!
job_title: Research Technician III in Athens, GA
pros: Great place to work, very flexible work-life balance.  Some development of employees is available in the form of course work, grant writing if your PI is willing.
cons: Grants became increasingly difficult to obtain and full time research staff was slowly being cut.  No State support for individuals in lab position so positions are really temporary contracts.  Be prepared to move or change labs.

review_title: The best college and basic science research experience
job_title: Graduate Research Assistant in Athens, GA
pros: As a graduate research assistant, I have enjoyed student life as well as the professional researchers life. UGA provides a fulfilling experience in both fronts.
cons: Since it is not a top tier university, sometimes, the standard and work ethics in some labs might not be up to par. There are some top notch labs and professors, but some profs are not so serious after they get their tenure.

pros: Athens is a fun place to live and study. The campus is pretty and clean. Most faculty members are helpful and nice.
cons: Anyways, those are somewhat general, but I hope they help adjusting to the large-school experience. Over time, UGA definitely does grow smaller, so don't get overwhelmed at first.

job_title: Food Service Worker in Athens, GA
pros: One of the better jobs to have as a student. Many student perks such as free food, an environment with all of your friends, etc.
cons: There is a twenty hour work cap per week which was only implemented recently. Keeps students like myself from earning more.

job_title: Adminsistrative Manager I in Athens, GA
pros: Located in a great college town with a top research university dedicated to public service and outreach. Has some of the top colleges in the nation: Business, Journalism, Agricultural, etc. Nationally known NCAA athletic program.
cons:
Employees have pay to park for work.
Pay is generally too low for the most mid to lower staff.
Decision making is glacial.

pros: Lots to do so time passes quickly, many friendly people around my age, beneficial, meet lots of new people and the staff and managers are very understanding
cons: Far away, so I get home late, no exact schedule or pay so I'm never sure how much money I'll get or what days I'll work until they're scheduled

job_title: Graduate Teaching Assistant in Athens, GA
pros: The overall climate at the university is welcoming. Campus itself is beautiful. There are lots of opportunities to get involved in student activities.
cons: University payroll system is a nightmare. I can't count the number of times something went wrong with my stipend or financial aid. Also, I never actually saw my graduate teaching contract so I'm not even sure what my rights were when it came to getting paid and advocating for myself.

pros:
Working as a peer tutor is a great part time job for a student. The hours are quite flexible, and the other tutors are generally also interested in academics and helping other students.
Awesome Tutor Appreciation Week!
cons: The Academic Policy of UGA makes it a little difficult to tutor certain things, so you have to stay aware of the guidelines at all times.

job_title: Peer Financial Aid Counselor in Athens, GA
pros: Great community environment. Darin Morris was by far the best supervisor a work-study student could ask for. He understood that we were students first, but always ensured that we felt like a respected employee.
cons: The only negative is that I don't think most students and parents take the time to understand how the financial aid process works so they have no choice but to blame it on the staff.

review_title: Good for those tied to Athens community with kids, but not so for the single, ambitious, or international..
pros:
- Good benefit (retirement, health insurance, etc.)
- Educational opportunities
- Safe and quite environment (good for families)
cons:
- Salary increase has been frozen for many years
- IT jobs salaries lower than the average of Athens/Clarke county (not to mention to the Atlanta level)
- Getting H1B for entry/junior positions would be very difficult

review_title: Work for one year, then LEAVE
job_title: Food Services Worker in Athens, GA
pros: It's a really flexible job on campus, and you get meals every four hours.
cons: It's really about who you know and not what you know. You can be a really hardworker but if you don't kiss up to management, then they'll pretend you don't exist. The coworkers are okay, the work is easy, but management overall makes it unenjoyable

review_title: UGA Food Services is great, but monotonous.
job_title: Food Service Worker in Athens, GA
pros: Easy to get hired. VERY lenient schedule. Open to changes. So friends and its a great environment. Get to eat at the dining hall. :)
cons: Monotonous for me. My own fault for scheduling one long 11 hour work day though. And the work is really quite easy, so I personally found it to be a bit boring. Other people feel differently. :) Small pay.

pros: Loads of researched based information that is very useful.  Always a lot of information regarding child care, 4-H, serving food safely, horticultural and agriculture.
cons: State jobs do not pay very well.  Lots of down time of not being busy all the time.  A lot of office back biting and gossip.  Not everyone works as a team player, one is always trying to out do the other.

pros: It is a great university with bright students, a beautiful campus, and a nice town.
cons: The budget crisis in georgia has put a halt to most foward-looking projects, and this is dispiriting to the staff and faculty. We constantly receive emails about budget cuts.

review_title: UGA employees are grossly underpaid and undervalued.
pros: The benefits are good, especially for Athens, which has a paucity of jobs over minimum wage. There are opportunities to obtain PEP jobs that are only offered to current UGA employees.
cons: Salaries are appallingly low, and the University is way behind the times with titles (and much more)...secretary? No one but government calls assistant positions that anymore. Lots of red tape and bureaucracy. Think triplicate forms.

pros: Awesome environment with great people. the ability to create your own job description and to get involved. great retirement and vacation. go dawgs
cons: limited ladder to climb. some of the experiment stations are in small towns where people are cliches. no way to advance in a timely fashion

pros: The people and and the place are great. I had a lot of fun working here.
cons: Hard to get hired permanently. I was a student worker while I was still at UGA and to be hired permanently full-time you need at least a masters degree (also its a small group that people don't often leave, so there aren't a lot of openings).

review_title: UGA Black Fly Lab is a great place to work
job_title: Undergraduate Research Assistant in Athens, GA
pros: The bosses were great in the black fly lab, tons of flexibility in hours and schedule. Elmer also gets students involved in his more interesting research. An amazing work environment all around. If you are an entomology student at UGA, this is a great lab to work in.
cons: Hours were limited at 20, and positions are student only.

pros: Great work life balance. Beautiful and thriving campus and community. Relatively stress free work environment. Friendly co-workers and supervisors.
cons: Low pay compared to private sector jobs. Lack of established career paths within the institution. Lack of professional mentorship opportunities.

pros: UGA is a great institution that works towards the land grant mission.
cons: UGA says it highly values teaching, but it values research and grants more as it tries to become a top-10 public university. In addition, the metrics for work performance are poorly delineated.  It is also rooted in the deep South, with conservative values that are not conducive to the diverse student body they try to recruit.

pros: You essentially get paid to do your homework. While the work can get very repetitive and sometimes boring if you're working the night shift, I thought this was one of the easiest jobs I've ever had.
cons: As a desk assistant, there really aren't many opportunities to advance.  If you are just looking for a part-time job for some extra money, however, this is a very good job!

job_title: Program Specialist II in Brunswick, GA
pros: Really cool projects, loved the flexibility and felt like we were making a difference in the community! Benefits were great and through UGA.
cons: A little isolated work environments not very much interaction with co-workers, low pay and not much zest for people who have been there a long time.

job_title: Program Specialist II in Brunswick, GA
pros: Over-all work being done is FANTASTIC! Great network of peers and community involvement.
cons: Work-load is stretched too thin from lack of funding for the amount of employees needed. Salaries are on the lower end for level of job expertise needed and standard of living.

review_title: Good place to work as a student, plenty of opportunities to work your way up to student management.
job_title: Climbing Wall Manager in Athens, GA
pros: The professional staff work well with students and there was always help available if we needed it, whether on the job or not.
cons: There was a very steady, almost constant, turnover of professional staff in the Recreational Sports department. As a student worker that outlasted many of the professionals, it was discouraging.

job_title: Graduate Research Assistant in Athens, GA
pros: Great place to work. Small labs provide individual freedom and creativity and breed collaborations. Most of the PIs encourage individual thinking and collaborations. Course work is very flexible as well. Athens is a great place to live and explore.
cons: Living in a college town, networking is an issue, particularly for biological fields. The area is not a hot-bed for bio companies like West or Northeast.

review_title: Wonderful experience! I highly recommend this to students!
job_title: Customer Service Associate in Athens, GA
pros: An extremely positive and encouraging work environment with great schedule flexibility. The tips can be lucrative during busy seasons and there is ample room for promotion within the hotel
cons: Can be slow at times which leads to less money in tips leaving you to rely on your hourly wage which is minimum to begin with until you get a raise.

review_title: Limited opportunities for advancement for contingent faculty.
pros: Being at a research university means being immersed in a lively intellectual environment. Lots of great resources and amenities: databases, libraries, lectures.
cons: There is little to no opportunity for advancement for contingent faculty. Contingent faculty are 1) on yearly contracts; 2) not eligible for most of the major university awards or funding for projects.

job_title: Research Technician III in Tifton, GA
pros:
Health insurance benefits
Leave accumulation
Retirement plan
Depending on the position, work can be minimal (My position did not fit this category)
cons: Despite training or experience, the faculty and administrators, in general, have no respect for the technical personnel.  Little opportunity for advancement - jobs are fixed.

review_title: Great job if you want time to study
pros:
Plenty of downtime if you like that
Easy to get time off
Make your own schedule practically
Some nice people
A lot of blue letter rules, basically don't get caught doing anything wrong and you can do whatever you like
cons:
Management communication is very poor
You are only noticed when you do something wrong

review_title: Good Benefits and Flexible schedule, bad pay
pros: Flexibility of schedule, free education for employees and respected institution.
cons: Low pay for staff members are not realistic or up to par with the level of work expected.

review_title: Great potential, going through some growing pains
job_title: Public Service Associate in Athens, GA
pros: Amazing colleagues when I began, a flexible schedule in some departments, great community to work in.
cons: Changes in leadership can have an immediate and negative impact on morale and flexibility.  Pay is also in a holding position with no annual raises (unless you get a promotion) in over 5 years.

review_title: Delightful, but minimum wage for the third year in a row...
job_title: Federal Work Study Student in Athens, GA
pros: Wonderful people, every day is different, lots of time to work on personal projects.
cons: Minimum wage for three years as a work study student, federally mandated - not their fault! Work could be a little boring, administrative tasks, etc.

pros:
A chance to pursue your intellectual interests for a living.
Co-workers were really nice.
Relaxed working atmosphere.
Athens is a nice place to live and work.
Access to all of the resources of a major research university.
cons:
Very bureaucratic. 
Organizational decisions are made very slowly and sometimes made by individuals that are not at all familiar with frontline conditions. 
Decisions are made on the basis of politics rather than performance.

review_title: Security Gurad at Main Library is a great job
pros: You can move around by doing rounds on every floor, you can also get homework done while working at the desk, and the management is great
cons: The uniforms are pretty lame and you have to work every other weekend or work one of the opener slots (early in the morning). It is closed on home football games though.

pros: Excellent Resources. This school offers plenty of opportunities to succeed and challenges students. Athens is a nice area with plenty to do.
cons: The coursework is difficult, and the large campus can be difficult to become accustomed to. There are not many more negatives.

job_title: Fitness and Wellness Monitor in Athens, GA
pros: This job is a lot of fun, I have learned a lot about all of the different classes that are offered and I get to take any fitness class that is offered.
cons: Sometimes there is not a lot to do, but it is easy to make yourself busy.

pros: Working at the University of Georgia EITS Department is rewarding, the hours flexible, and good communication between coworkers.
cons: No real cons besides a lack of clear-cut responsibilities, but in the IT sphere you wear many hats so it isn't strange that your day-to-day responsibilities are different

review_title: You get what you put in
job_title: Graduate Research Assistant in Athens, GA
pros: Low pressure atmosphere; Access to excellent research facilities; Collaborative atmosphere; Beautiful campus; Ramsey Center, the recreational center, is top-notch.
cons: Salary is relatively low, but Athens has a relatively low cost-of-living; Mandatory health insurance for graduate students is not too expensive and services at the University Health Center are free or very cheap, but health insurance for dependents is very pricey.

pros: Working events at the Botanical gardens was a great experience. There was a wide range of things happening that allowed for a lot of different skills to be developed. I got to interact with the employees, volunteers, and the community at the gardens and had a very positive experience there. And it is a beautiful place to work!
cons: No cons to working here!

review_title: Great coworkers, good benefits and stability, but low pay and a lot of politics
pros: I've worked with a number of great people and Athens is a great place to live, play, retire, and  raise children.
cons: A lot of politics, anti-change policies, low pay and no raises for years.

job_title: Graduate Research Assistant in Athens, GA
pros: Great employees, good staff and supervisors depending on your department.  Paid to take classes and do research. Departmental vans for research.
cons: No room for growth or to continue after graduation. Have to compete with students for parking and space on campus.

pros: Good benefits, holidays off, inclement weather pay, great retirement, and weekends off
cons: Health Insurance goes up every year and is pricey, upper management can be rude and shows favoritism, pay is not great after all the deductions, parking fees are deducted from your check monthly or yearly, faculty gets better perks than staff, raises are low and scarce

review_title: Its a job... not a career.
job_title: Building Services Supervisor in Athens, GA
pros:
Some flexibility
Great HR Benefits
You can get your BA for only the cost of supplies and books.
cons:
They will treat you poorly if they can get away with it.
They will make promises to you, get it in writing.
They will throw you under the bus if it it to the organizations advantage.

review_title: Great place to work during graduate school.
job_title: Graduate Research Assistant in Athens, GA
pros:
Classes are well taught
Numerous courses in each major
Lab research is offered for most science majors and can count as years of experience.
Good food at Tate Center
cons:
Campus is very hilly
Buses are overcrowded
Dining halls are expensive
First come first serve seating to a few football games in 2014 where they actually turned away students who had a ticket.

pros: Flexible hours to accommodate a full time student's schedule. Pays higher than minimum wage. Coworkers are very friendly.
cons: Some employees lack motivation and require assistance to compensate for lacking performance. Some tasks may be tedious or repetitive at times.

pros: Great support network with the right supervisor, undergraduate student staff, and overall community, if one puts in the work.
cons: On call structure changes/could change midyear. Enforced hierarchy/reporting up that sometimes requires supervisor attention/consulting even in the simplest of cases. Undergraduates aren't qualified to make "final" decisions or actually problem solve, but must instead rely on instruction from higher up.

pros: There are some great people trying to do diversity work here.
cons: The current state legislatures ties the hands of the upper administration in allowing people at the university to do real/good diversity work.

review_title: Student worker experience from the trenches of UGA
pros: Great place to work if you're a student on campus, lots of options for transportation and decent resources.
cons: There is no free parking on campus and most lots run $30-40/month which can add up.  Most positions are paid minimum or $1-2 over minimum.  There's no clear path for hourly increase or transition to salary.

job_title: Football Student Manager in Athens, GA
pros: Great academics and lots of opportunities to get involved on campus. Great greek life.
cons: Big school and big classes, so there's not much personal attention from teachers and staff. Campus is huge too and can be tough to navigate.

job_title: Graduate Research Assistant in Athens, GA
pros: Great school with great people in a great college town. If you have the opportunity to work here, do it.
cons: As a Grad Assistant you get a tuition waiver but still have to pay fees that are in excess of $1000 a semester.

pros: good benefits, low stress, great location, great brand
cons: no effective performance management, too much emphasis on seniority instead of performance, practically impossible to get fired, full of slackers.  typical state agency - very demotivating for high achievers.

pros: Employees get plenty of time off and a very flexible schedule. Jobs tend to be very low pressure and not stressful
cons: Because this is a state institution, salaries are lower than would be in the private sector. Athens also has a lower per capita income than Atlanta and salaries are even further reduced than normal.

pros: UGA really focuses on improving their employees which is to be expected from an academic environment. Leeway is given for those who wish to be creative in their positions.
cons: sometimes the restrictions of working within a university can be frustrating

pros: Great to work for the institution you are attending.
cons: Management is bad. Policies change and matters are handled publicly, without discretion and in an inconsistent manner. In addition, there is a clicky department and there is a lot of spying and tattle-telling for things that are seemingly harmless. The environment makes for an inefficient and hostile workplace.

pros: Annual Leave - Sick Leave & Shared Leave
cons: Salary - Benefits - Salary - Communication - Salary

review_title: Good environment for basic life science postdocs
pros: Typically friendly working environment very conducive to collaborations.  High-quality microbial and plant research.  Great retention rate.  Low cost of living.  Fantastic benefits.
cons: Little medical research unless tied to infectious disease.  Research-hospital ties almost non-existent.  Postdoc pay scale below NIH guidelines.

job_title: Food Services Team Member in Athens, GA
pros: Great Benefits (free meal with every shift - as much as you wanted, easy work at times), Good with schedules.
cons: I felt like I did not matter there. Promotions are not based on merit. Work was difficult based on where they put you (dishroom or vacuuming)

review_title: Good place to work with strong HR
pros: HR department is well-run with a strong response to reported issues. Decently fair wages as well. Good focus on keeping employees happy with workload as well as little things like sometimes buying food for everyone.
cons: Just that there is little opportunity to advance. It's higher education so people get very ingrained in their positions.

review_title: It has the potential to be a great place to work
pros:
If you're looking for a small-town atmosphere, then this is the place.
Great students!
cons: Nepotism abounds here.  Growth potential extremely limited despite going above and beyond.  One must be part of the good ol' boys' network for advancement.  Pay freezes, furloughs, increases to employee contributions toward benefits and parking.

review_title: The hotel is such a great place to work--the people are great and the experiences are great--but they overlook students.
job_title: Front Desk Associate in Athens, GA
pros: Amazing coworkers--almost like a family. Some really amazing guests. The atmosphere of a football school.
cons: Pay rate. Some horrible guests. Lots of work.

pros: As an undergraduate Research Assistant, you will learn a lot. You will have hands on exposure to many procedures and techniques that you can only really understand outside of a classroom setting.
cons: You will need to be dedicated and committed to  your research because you will spend most of your off hours in the lab.

review_title: Needs better care for grad students
pros: Research 1 uni with many resources, funds PhD students.
cons: Sexual assault scandal in my department, needs to increase graduate student pay / be more transparent with necessary fees. Teaching duties are inconsistent across departments, which is insane because sometimes students from an academic department are teaching through another and there needs to be better coordination.

pros: Great environment, beautiful campus.  Athens is a fun town with a reasonable cost of living.
cons: There have been no official salary increases for 4 years. Employees with political connections are able to get raises some how, and this has lead to jealousy and discontent among other employees.

review_title: Several years during lean times is not a good way to measure the longevity of a company.
job_title: IT Professional Specialist in Athens, GA
pros: Stable work environment, Good pension,
cons: Low pay. If you are looking for an IT job within 10,000 of the median IT pay for the state...don't go here.

pros: Great coworkers and supervisors. Work well with class schedule to get hours to work with school. You get to self manage your bus with no other coworkers on board.
cons: Passengers can be a little difficult to handle.

job_title: UGA Hotel and Conference Center Front Desk Clerk in Athens, GA
pros:
-amazing co-workers
-flexible schedule
-located on UGA's campus
-raises based on knowledge of desk responsibilities 
-improve in-person communication and phone skills
cons:
-sometimes have to deal with irritated guests that aren't exactly friendly 
-shifts can be overwhelming at times due to high influx of guests checking in 
-computer system can be finicky and hard to deal with

job_title: Food Service Worker in Athens, GA
pros: Wonderful environment, great hours, good gig for students working part time, flexible hours which is great for students, on campus job
cons: Working with less than delightful customers but everywhere has that, wish pay was higher, sometimes you'd get bored, not really any room for promotion

job_title: Student Shelving Assistant in Athens, GA
pros: They worked with student's schedules when scheduling and were always extremely understanding of their employee's outside lives.
cons: The work could get a bit dull but that was a trade-off that came with excellent supervisors.

pros: I loved it. Most professors are there to see you do well. You can talk to them about anything and they will answer and be there.
cons: It's a research institution so some professors may be here to simply do research and do not care about you doing well in the class

review_title: Benefits are good, pay is not
job_title: Research Analyst II in Athens, GA
pros: Laid-back work environment. Good Healthcare, dental, and vision benefits.
cons: Pay is dismal for experience level. Bureaucracy gets in the way of doing your job. Employees have to pay for parking.

pros: Consistent hours, good managers, and an excellent location made my time at UGA food services worthwhile. I would recommend this to any student at UGA.
cons: The pay was not very good, and opportunity for advancement is scarce. While it paid the bills, the work was monotonous and tiring.

pros: You just have to give your 100% and you will get the best in return. They help you out in every way possible
cons: It is pretty difficult to manage things out if you are studying as well as working but there are no major cons as such.

job_title: Graduate Research Assistant in Athens, GA
pros:
Great faculty and colleagues to work wtih
Some internal funding
Great bus system
cons: Really steep student fees, even if you are a graduate student on an assistantship. If you teach in the summer, half of your pay goes back to paying student fees, since you have to be enrolled during the summer in order to teach.

job_title: Graduate Research Assistant in Athens, GA
pros: Great town to live in, the university has an awesome bus system which makes it so easy to get around.
cons: As a student, you have to pay for football tickets which is not the case everywhere..semester fees also take out a huge chunk of the minimal salary you get paid as a graduate student.

job_title: Applications Programmer Associate in Athens, GA
pros: UGA has a nice work environment and working on campus is really nice. Work loads are fairly average and the benefits are really great. Teacher's retirement is amazing if you've already worked up your salary.
cons: Difficult to get pay raises or promotions without moving from job to job.

pros: Allows many opportunities to make the most of your education. Excellent culture and environment. Faculty are helpful in everything from research to classwork.
cons: Graduate student fees went up significantly, to the point of being close to 10% of the annual stipend, and that's without mandatory insurance. Campus gets busy with so many students.

review_title: Challenging yet flexible environment, large campus atmosphere that strives for smaller community environment
pros: Flexibility, Great People, Academic Prestige, Diversity of Experiences within Job Roles, Excellent Mid-level Management, room for Growth & Innovation
cons: Bureaucratic nature of decisions, high employee turnover, parking/employee benefits

review_title: Great University, but not very pleasant experiences with Administration
job_title: Lab Manager I in Athens, GA
pros: Great University for kids! Great town to raise the family. A lot of things to do in surrounding cities/states.
cons: Some administrative departments are not very supportive or pleasant to work with. For example, the international student office was not efficient or sometimes even not professional.

review_title: What you'd expect from most food service jobs
job_title: UGA Food Services in Athens, GA
pros: Fellow coworkers are great and fun to be around. Free food on break. Flexible schedule.
cons: Management can make some poor decisions. Sometimes create more stress than necessary.

job_title: Chief Engineer TV/Radio in Athens, GA
pros: good benefits, nice atmosphere, and safe place.
cons: Snarky people who have never worked anyplace but there. State job folks who think they are entitled and have it so bad.

job_title: Research Technician III in Sapelo Island, GA
pros: Great people to work with, a truly fun job with lots of time outdoors, flexibility in schedule, good benefits, low cost housing in a great location, lots of autonomy - no micro-managing.
cons: Low salary, not much room to move upwards, living on Sapelo can make you feel like you're always at work

job_title: Graduate Teaching Assistant in Athens, GA
pros: Great campus and students with assistantsships have it pretty good. As a student and part-time employee, the universities works around your schedule to allow for both schedules to work.
cons: Depends on your luck, you might get a lot of TA load that might hinder your own personal work.

pros: The work environment was fantastic, including varied flexibility in holding office hours and submitting graded assignments. Working with all of the faculty and students was fantastic.
cons: Downsides include proctoring late exams, but this is definitely not frequent.

pros:
- Very flexible hours
- Paid for transportation 
- Experience in working while in college
- Very relaxed feel
cons:
- Pay is minimum wage
- You might not get the position you wanted
- Compensation max is low

job_title: Grad Student TA in Athens, GA
pros:
I have taught a number of motivated, intellectually curious students. 

Health insurance for grad students is very good, although they might be taking away the subsidy, which would be terrible.

Athens, GA is an inexpensive and wonderful place to live.
cons: The bureaucracy is totally dysfunctional. Grad student stipends are abysmal for the humanities.

pros: Employees are able to play golf and also use the driving range for free when off duty. Laid back environment.
cons: While i was working there, there was a turnaround of management so it was very inconsistent. Job was very boring, a lot of sitting around and waiting for something to do.

review_title: CCRC, UGA is a good place to work
job_title: PhD Research Assistant in Athens, GA
pros: If you are interested in doing carbohydrate-related research, then the Complex Carbohydrate Research Center is definitely one of the best place to go.
cons: Athens is a college town therefore it would be difficult to look for some industry opportunities when you finish school.

pros: Great flexible place to work while being a student and fun staff. Easy and mindless work makes it easy to focus on schoolwork
cons: You have to be willing to be okay with any kind of food service work, like washing dishes or cleaning raw chicken at 5 AM

pros: Good environment to work it. There are a lot of smart people and lots to learn. Benefits are great and teacher's retirement plan is one of the best.
